+   391‚Üí      controls,
+   392‚Üí      colors
+   393‚Üí    };
+   394‚Üí
+   395‚Üí    if (modeName !== undefined) {
+   396‚Üí      result.name = modeName;
+   397‚Üí    }
+   398‚Üí
+   399‚Üí    return result;
+   400‚Üí  }
+   401‚Üí
+   402‚Üí  /**
+   403‚Üí   * Build device inquiry request
+   404‚Üí   * @deprecated Use the complete handshake sequence with buildNovationSyn()
+   405‚Üí   * and buildUniversalDeviceInquiry() instead. This method only performs
+   406‚Üí   * partial handshake and uses incorrect device ID.
+   407‚Üí   */
+   408‚Üí  static buildDeviceQuery(): number[] {
+   409‚Üí    return [
+   410‚Üí      0xF0, // SysEx start
+   411‚Üí      0x7E, // Universal non-realtime
+   412‚Üí      0x00, // Device ID (broadcast)
+   413‚Üí      0x06, // General information
+   414‚Üí      0x01, // Identity request
+   415‚Üí      0xF7, // SysEx end
+   416‚Üí    ];
+   417‚Üí  }
+   418‚Üí
+   419‚Üí  /**
+   420‚Üí   * Build Novation SYN message for complete handshake sequence
+   421‚Üí   *
+   422‚Üí   * This is the first message in the 4-message handshake protocol.
+   423‚Üí   * The device will respond with a SYN-ACK containing its serial number.
+   424‚Üí   *
+   425‚Üí   * Message format: F0 00 20 29 00 42 02 F7 (8 bytes)
+   426‚Üí   *
+   427‚Üí   * @returns {number[]} SysEx message bytes for Novation SYN request
+   428‚Üí   */
+   429‚Üí  static buildNovationSyn(): number[] {
+   430‚Üí    return [
+   431‚Üí      0xF0,              // SysEx start
+   432‚Üí      0x00, 0x20, 0x29,  // Novation manufacturer ID
+   433‚Üí      0x00,              // Device model (Launch Control)
+   434‚Üí      0x42,              // Command (handshake)
+   435‚Üí      0x02,              // Sub-command (SYN)
+   436‚Üí      0xF7               // SysEx end
+   437‚Üí    ];
+   438‚Üí  }
+   439‚Üí
+   440‚Üí  /**
+   441‚Üí   * Build Universal Device Inquiry message with correct device ID
+   442‚Üí   *
+   443‚Üí   * This is the third message in the 4-message handshake protocol (ACK).
+   444‚Üí   * Uses the correct broadcast device ID (0x7F) instead of 0x00.
+   445‚Üí   *
+   446‚Üí   * Message format: F0 7E 7F 06 01 F7 (6 bytes)
+   447‚Üí   *
+   448‚Üí   * @returns {number[]} SysEx message bytes for Universal Device Inquiry
+   449‚Üí   */
+   450‚Üí  static buildUniversalDeviceInquiry(): number[] {
+   451‚Üí    return [
+   452‚Üí      0xF0,              // SysEx start
+   453‚Üí      0x7E,              // Universal Non-Realtime
+   454‚Üí      0x7F,              // Device ID (broadcast)
+   455‚Üí      0x06,              // Sub-ID 1 (Device Inquiry)
+   456‚Üí      0x01,              // Sub-ID 2 (Inquiry Request)
+   457‚Üí      0xF7               // SysEx end
+   458‚Üí    ];
+   459‚Üí  }
+   460‚Üí
+   461‚Üí  /**
+   462‚Üí   * Parse Novation SYN-ACK response and extract serial number
+   463‚Üí   *
+   464‚Üí   * This parses the second message in the 4-message handshake protocol.
+   465‚Üí   * The SYN-ACK response contains the device's serial number.
+   466‚Üí   *
+   467‚Üí   * Expected format: F0 00 20 29 00 42 02 [SERIAL_NUMBER] F7 (22 bytes)
+   468‚Üí   * Serial number is 14 ASCII characters at bytes 7-20.
+   469‚Üí   *
+   470‚Üí   * @param {number[]} data - Raw SysEx message bytes including F0/F7
+   471‚Üí   * @returns {object} Parsing result with validity flag and optional serial number
+   472‚Üí   * @returns {boolean} returns.valid - True if message is valid SYN-ACK
+   473‚Üí   * @returns {string} [returns.serialNumber] - Device serial number if valid
+   474‚Üí   */
+   475‚Üí  static parseNovationSynAck(data: number[]): { valid: boolean; serialNumber?: string } {
+   476‚Üí    // Validate message length (should be exactly 22 bytes)
+   477‚Üí    if (data.length !== 22) {
+   478‚Üí      return { valid: false };
+   479‚Üí    }
+   480‚Üí
+   481‚Üí    // Validate SysEx start and end bytes
+   482‚Üí    if (data[0] !== 0xF0 || data[data.length - 1] !== 0xF7) {
+   483‚Üí      return { valid: false };
+   484‚Üí    }
+   485‚Üí
+   486‚Üí    // Verify Novation manufacturer ID (bytes 1-3)
+   487‚Üí    if (data[1] !== 0x00 || data[2] !== 0x20 || data[3] !== 0x29) {
+   488‚Üí      return { valid: false };
+   489‚Üí    }
+   490‚Üí
+   491‚Üí    // Verify command bytes (bytes 4-6)
+   492‚Üí    if (data[4] !== 0x00 || data[5] !== 0x42 || data[6] !== 0x02) {
+   493‚Üí      return { valid: false };
+   494‚Üí    }
+   495‚Üí
+   496‚Üí    // Extract serial number (bytes 7-20, 14 characters)
+   497‚Üí    const serialBytes = data.slice(7, 21);
+   498‚Üí
+   499‚Üí    // Validate that all serial bytes are printable ASCII
+   500‚Üí    for (const byte of serialBytes) {
+   501‚Üí      if (byte < 32 || byte > 126) {
+   502‚Üí        return { valid: false };
+   503‚Üí      }
+   504‚Üí    }
+   505‚Üí
+   506‚Üí    const serialNumber = String.fromCharCode(...serialBytes);
+   507‚Üí
+   508‚Üí    // Basic validation of Launch Control XL3 serial number format
+   509‚Üí    // Should start with "LX2" followed by digits
+   510‚Üí    if (!serialNumber.startsWith('LX2') || serialNumber.length !== 14) {
+   511‚Üí      return { valid: false };
+   512‚Üí    }
+   513‚Üí
+   514‚Üí    return { valid: true, serialNumber };
+   515‚Üí  }
+   516‚Üí
+   517‚Üí  /**
+   518‚Üí   * Build template change message
+   519‚Üí   */
+   520‚Üí  static buildTemplateChange(templateNumber: number): number[] {
+   521‚Üí    if (templateNumber < 0 || templateNumber > 15) {
+   522‚Üí      throw new Error('Template number must be 0-15');
+   523‚Üí    }
+   524‚Üí
+   525‚Üí    return [
+   526‚Üí      0xF0, // SysEx start
+   527‚Üí      ...MANUFACTURER_ID,
+   528‚Üí      0x11, // Device ID (Launch Control XL)
+   529‚Üí      SysExMessageType.TEMPLATE_CHANGE,
+   530‚Üí      templateNumber,
+   531‚Üí      0xF7, // SysEx end
+   532‚Üí    ];
+   533‚Üí  }
+   534‚Üí
+   535‚Üí  /**
+   536‚Üí   * Build custom mode read request
+   537‚Üí   */
+   538‚Üí  static buildCustomModeReadRequest(slot: number): number[] {
+   539‚Üí    if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
+   540‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');
+   541‚Üí    }
+   542‚Üí
+   543‚Üí    // CORRECTED PROTOCOL: Based on working MIDI capture from web editor
+   544‚Üí    // Format: F0 00 20 29 02 15 05 00 40 [SLOT] 00 F7
+   545‚Üí    return [
+   546‚Üí      0xF0,             // SysEx start
+   547‚Üí      0x00, 0x20, 0x29, // Manufacturer ID (Novation)
+   548‚Üí      0x02,             // Device ID (Launch Control XL 3)
+   549‚Üí      0x15,             // Command (Custom mode)
+   550‚Üí      0x05,             // Sub-command
+   551‚Üí      0x00,             // Reserved
+   552‚Üí      0x40,             // Read operation (CORRECTED from 0x15)
+   553‚Üí      slot,             // Slot number (0-14 for slots 1-15)
+   554‚Üí      0x00,             // Parameter (CORRECTED from nothing)
+   555‚Üí      0xF7              // SysEx end
+   556‚Üí    ];
+   557‚Üí  }
+   558‚Üí
+   559‚Üí  /**
+   560‚Üí   * Build custom mode write message from CustomMode object
+   561‚Üí   */
+   562‚Üí  static buildCustomModeWriteMessage(slot: number, customMode: CustomMode): number[] {
+   563‚Üí    if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
+   564‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');
+   565‚Üí    }
+   566‚Üí
+   567‚Üí    const rawData: number[] = [];
+   568‚Üí
+   569‚Üí    // Header: Mode data format indicator
+   570‚Üí    rawData.push(0x00, 0x20, 0x08);
+   571‚Üí
+   572‚Üí    // Mode name: Direct ASCII encoding (max 8 chars)
+   573‚Üí    const nameBytes = customMode.name.substring(0, 8);
+   574‚Üí    for (let i = 0; i < nameBytes.length; i++) {
+   575‚Üí      rawData.push(nameBytes.charCodeAt(i));
+   576‚Üí    }
+   577‚Üí
+   578‚Üí    // Sort controls by ID for consistency
+   579‚Üí    const sortedControls = Object.values(customMode.controls)
+   580‚Üí      .filter(control => control.controlId !== undefined)
+   581‚Üí      .sort((a, b) => (a.controlId ?? 0) - (b.controlId ?? 0));
+   582‚Üí
+   583‚Üí    // Add control definitions with 0x49 marker and offset
+   584‚Üí    for (const control of sortedControls) {
+   585‚Üí      // Write control structure: 11 bytes
+   586‚Üí      rawData.push(0x49); // Write control marker
+   587‚Üí      rawData.push((control.controlId ?? 0) + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
+   588‚Üí      rawData.push(0x02); // Definition type
+   589‚Üí      // Convert control type to number if it's a string
+   590‚Üí      const controlType = control.controlType ?? control.type ?? 0x00;
+   591‚Üí      const controlTypeNum = typeof controlType === 'string' ?
+   592‚Üí        (controlType === 'knob' ? 0x05 : controlType === 'fader' ? 0x00 : controlType === 'button' ? 0x09 : 0x00) :
+   593‚Üí        controlType;
+   594‚Üí      rawData.push(controlTypeNum); // Control type
+   595‚Üí      rawData.push(control.midiChannel ?? control.channel ?? 0); // MIDI channel (0-15)
+   596‚Üí      rawData.push(0x01); // Parameter 1
+   597‚Üí      rawData.push(0x40); // Parameter 2
+   598‚Üí      rawData.push(0x00); // Min value (always 0 in write)
+   599‚Üí      rawData.push(control.ccNumber ?? control.cc ?? 0); // CC number
+   600‚Üí      rawData.push(0x7F); // Max value (always 0x7F in write)
+   601‚Üí      rawData.push(0x00); // Terminator
+   602‚Üí    }
+   603‚Üí
+   604‚Üí    // Add label data if present
+   605‚Üí    if (customMode.labels && customMode.labels.size > 0) {
+   606‚Üí      for (const [controlId, label] of customMode.labels) {
+   607‚Üí        rawData.push(0x69); // Label marker
+   608‚Üí        rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
+   609‚Üí        // Add label text
+   610‚Üí        for (let i = 0; i < label.length; i++) {
+   611‚Üí          rawData.push(label.charCodeAt(i));
+   612‚Üí        }
+   613‚Üí      }
+   614‚Üí    } else {
+   615‚Üí      // Generate default labels for controls
+   616‚Üí      for (const control of sortedControls) {
+   617‚Üí        const controlId = control.controlId ?? 0;
+   618‚Üí        rawData.push(0x69); // Label marker
+   619‚Üí        rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
+   620‚Üí        const label = this.generateControlLabel(controlId);
+   621‚Üí        for (let i = 0; i < label.length; i++) {
+   622‚Üí          rawData.push(label.charCodeAt(i));
+   623‚Üí        }
+   624‚Üí      }
+   625‚Üí    }
+   626‚Üí
+   627‚Üí    // Add color data if present
+   628‚Üí    if (customMode.colors && customMode.colors.size > 0) {
+   629‚Üí      for (const [controlId, color] of customMode.colors) {
+   630‚Üí        rawData.push(0x60); // Color marker
+   631‚Üí        rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
+   632‚Üí        rawData.push(color); // Color value
+   633‚Üí      }
+   634‚Üí    } else {
+   635‚Üí      // Add default colors (off) for all controls
+   636‚Üí      for (const control of sortedControls) {
+   637‚Üí        const controlId = control.controlId ?? 0;
+   638‚Üí        rawData.push(0x60); // Color marker
+   639‚Üí        rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
+   640‚Üí      }
+   641‚Üí    }
+   642‚Üí
+   643‚Üí    // Build complete message
+   644‚Üí    return [
+   645‚Üí      0xF0,             // SysEx start
+   646‚Üí      0x00, 0x20, 0x29, // Manufacturer ID (Novation)
+   647‚Üí      0x02,             // Device ID (Launch Control XL 3)
+   648‚Üí      0x15,             // Command (Custom mode)
+   649‚Üí      0x05,             // Sub-command
+   650‚Üí      0x00,             // Reserved
+   651‚Üí      0x45,             // Write operation
+   652‚Üí      slot,             // Slot number
+   653‚Üí      ...rawData,       // Custom mode data
+   654‚Üí      0xF7              // SysEx end
+   655‚Üí    ];
+   656‚Üí  }
+   657‚Üí
+   658‚Üí  /**
+   659‚Üí   * Build custom mode write request
+   660‚Üí   */
+   661‚Üí  static buildCustomModeWriteRequest(slot: number, modeData: CustomModeMessage): number[] {
+   662‚Üí    if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
+   663‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');
+   664‚Üí    }
+   665‚Üí
+   666‚Üí    // Validate the custom mode data
+   667‚Üí    this.validateCustomModeData(modeData);
+   668‚Üí
+   669‚Üí    // Encode the custom mode data
+   670‚Üí    const encodedData = this.encodeCustomModeData(modeData);
+   671‚Üí
+   672‚Üí    // CORRECTED PROTOCOL: Based on Launch Control XL 3 format
+   673‚Üí    // Format: F0 00 20 29 02 15 05 00 45 [SLOT] [encoded data] F7
+   674‚Üí    return [
+   675‚Üí      0xF0,             // SysEx start
+   676‚Üí      0x00, 0x20, 0x29, // Manufacturer ID (Novation)
+   677‚Üí      0x02,             // Device ID (Launch Control XL 3)
+   678‚Üí      0x15,             // Command (Custom mode)
+   679‚Üí      0x05,             // Sub-command
+   680‚Üí      0x00,             // Reserved
+   681‚Üí      0x45,             // Write operation (assumed based on pattern)
+   682‚Üí      slot,             // Slot number (0-14 for slots 1-15)
+   683‚Üí      ...encodedData,   // Encoded custom mode data
+   684‚Üí      0xF7              // SysEx end
+   685‚Üí    ];
+   686‚Üí  }
+   687‚Üí
+   688‚Üí  /**
+   689‚Üí   * Validate custom mode data
+   690‚Üí   */
+   691‚Üí  static validateCustomModeData(modeData: CustomModeMessage): void {
+   692‚Üí    if (!modeData.controls || !Array.isArray(modeData.controls)) {
+   693‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode must have controls array');
+   694‚Üí    }
+   695‚Üí
+   696‚Üí    if (!modeData.colors || !Array.isArray(modeData.colors)) {
+   697‚Üí      throw new Error('Custom mode must have colors array');
+   698‚Üí    }
+   699‚Üí
+   700‚Üí    // Validate each control mapping
+   701‚Üí    for (const control of modeData.controls) {
+   702‚Üí      const ccNumber = control.ccNumber ?? control.cc ?? 0;
+   703‚Üí      if (ccNumber < 0 || ccNumber > 127) {
+   704‚Üí        throw new Error('CC number must be 0-127');
+   705‚Üí      }
+   706‚Üí
+   707‚Üí      const channel = control.channel ?? control.midiChannel ?? 0;
+   708‚Üí      if (channel < 0 || channel > 15) {
+   709‚Üí        throw new Error('Channel must be 0-15');
+   710‚Üí      }
+   711‚Üí
+   712‚Üí      const minValue = control.minValue ?? control.min ?? 0;
+   713‚Üí      if (minValue < 0 || minValue > 127) {
+   714‚Üí        throw new Error('Min value must be 0-127');
+   715‚Üí      }
+   716‚Üí
+   717‚Üí      const maxValue = control.maxValue ?? control.max ?? 127;
+   718‚Üí      if (maxValue < 0 || maxValue > 127) {
+   719‚Üí        throw new Error('Max value must be 0-127');
+   720‚Üí      }
+   721‚Üí
+   722‚Üí      if (minValue > maxValue) {
+   723‚Üí        throw new Error('Min value cannot be greater than max value');
+   724‚Üí      }
+   725‚Üí    }
+   726‚Üí
+   727‚Üí    // Validate each color mapping
+   728‚Üí    for (const color of modeData.colors) {
+   729‚Üí      if (color.color < 0 || color.color > 127) {
+   730‚Üí        throw new Error('Color value must be 0-127');
+   731‚Üí      }
+   732‚Üí    }
+   733‚Üí  }
+   734‚Üí
+   735‚Üí  /**
+   736‚Üí   * Encode custom mode data for Launch Control XL 3 transmission
+   737‚Üí   * Based on actual web editor protocol analysis
+   738‚Üí   */
+   739‚Üí  private static encodeCustomModeData(modeData: CustomModeMessage): number[] {
+   740‚Üí    const rawData: number[] = [];
+   741‚Üí
+   742‚Üí    // Header: Mode data format indicator
+   743‚Üí    rawData.push(0x00, 0x20, 0x08);
+   744‚Üí
+   745‚Üí    // Mode name: Direct ASCII encoding (not Midimunge!)
+   746‚Üí    if (modeData.name) {
+   747‚Üí      for (let i = 0; i < modeData.name.length && i < 16; i++) {
+   748‚Üí        rawData.push(modeData.name.charCodeAt(i));
+   749‚Üí      }
+   750‚Üí    }
+   751‚Üí
+   752‚Üí    // Add control definitions - must be in specific order for device to accept
+   753‚Üí    // Sort controls by ID to ensure proper order
+   754‚Üí    const sortedControls = [...modeData.controls]
+   755‚Üí      .filter(control => control.controlId !== undefined)
+   756‚Üí      .sort((a, b) => (a.controlId ?? 0) - (b.controlId ?? 0));
+   757‚Üí
+   758‚Üí    for (const control of sortedControls) {
+   759‚Üí      // Control format from web editor for WRITE operation:
+   760‚Üí      // Faders: 0x49 [ID] 0x02 0x00 [CH] 0x01 0x40 0x00 [CC] 0x7F 0x00
+   761‚Üí      // Top encoders: 0x49 [ID] 0x02 0x05 [CH] 0x01 0x40 0x00 [CC] 0x7F 0x00
+   762‚Üí      // Mid encoders: 0x49 [ID] 0x02 0x09 [CH] 0x01 0x40 0x00 [CC] 0x7F 0x00
+   763‚Üí      // Bot encoders: 0x49 [ID] 0x02 0x0D [CH] 0x01 0x40 0x00 [CC] 0x7F 0x00
+   764‚Üí
+   765‚Üí      const controlId = control.controlId ?? 0;
+   766‚Üí      const channel = control.channel ?? control.midiChannel ?? 0;
+   767‚Üí      const ccNumber = control.ccNumber ?? control.cc ?? 0;
+   768‚Üí
+   769‚Üí      rawData.push(0x49); // Control marker for WRITE
+   770‚Üí      rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // IMPORTANT: Add 0x28 offset for controls!
+   771‚Üí      rawData.push(0x02); // Control definition type
+   772‚Üí
+   773‚Üí      // Control type based on hardware position
+   774‚Üí      let controlType = 0x00;
+   775‚Üí      if (controlId >= 0x10 && controlId <= 0x17) {
+   776‚Üí        controlType = 0x05; // Top row encoders
+   777‚Üí      } else if (controlId >= 0x18 && controlId <= 0x1F) {
+   778‚Üí        controlType = 0x09; // Middle row encoders
+   779‚Üí      } else if (controlId >= 0x20 && controlId <= 0x27) {
+   780‚Üí        controlType = 0x0D; // Bottom row encoders
+   781‚Üí      } else if (controlId >= 0x00 && controlId <= 0x07) {
+   782‚Üí        controlType = 0x00; // Faders
+   783‚Üí      }
+   784‚Üí
+   785‚Üí      rawData.push(controlType);
+   786‚Üí      rawData.push(channel); // Channel (0-based)
+   787‚Üí      rawData.push(0x01); // Parameter 1
+   788‚Üí      rawData.push(0x40); // Parameter 2 (behavior)
+   789‚Üí      rawData.push(0x00); // Min value (always 0x00 in write)
+   790‚Üí      rawData.push(ccNumber); // CC number
+   791‚Üí      rawData.push(0x7F); // Max value (always 0x7F in write)
+   792‚Üí      rawData.push(0x00); // Terminator
+   793‚Üí    }
+   794‚Üí
+   795‚Üí    // CRITICAL: Add label/color data after controls - REQUIRED by device!
+   796‚Üí    // Without this section, the device rejects the message
+   797‚Üí
+   798‚Üí    // Add label data for each control (recommended for usability)
+   799‚Üí    for (const control of sortedControls) {
+   800‚Üí      const controlId = control.controlId ?? 0;
+   801‚Üí      rawData.push(0x69); // Label marker
+   802‚Üí      rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
+   803‚Üí
+   804‚Üí      // Add a simple label based on control type and ID
+   805‚Üí      const labelText = this.generateControlLabel(controlId);
+   806‚Üí      for (let i = 0; i < labelText.length; i++) {
+   807‚Üí        rawData.push(labelText.charCodeAt(i));
+   808‚Üí      }
+   809‚Üí    }
+   810‚Üí
+   811‚Üí    // Add color data for each control (required for device acceptance)
+   812‚Üí    for (const control of sortedControls) {
+   813‚Üí      const controlId = control.controlId ?? 0;
+   814‚Üí      rawData.push(0x60); // Color marker
+   815‚Üí      rawData.push(controlId + 0x28); // Control ID with offset
+   816‚Üí    }
+   817‚Üí
+   818‚Üí    return rawData;
+   819‚Üí  }
+   820‚Üí
+   821‚Üí
+   822‚Üí  /**
+   823‚Üí   * Generate a simple label for a control based on its ID and type
+   824‚Üí   */
+   825‚Üí  private static generateControlLabel(controlId: number): string {
+   826‚Üí    if (controlId >= 0x00 && controlId <= 0x07) {
+   827‚Üí      return `Fader ${controlId + 1}`;
+   828‚Üí    } else if (controlId >= 0x10 && controlId <= 0x17) {
+   829‚Üí      return `Top ${controlId - 0x10 + 1}`;
+   830‚Üí    } else if (controlId >= 0x18 && controlId <= 0x1F) {
+   831‚Üí      return `Mid ${controlId - 0x18 + 1}`;
+   832‚Üí    } else if (controlId >= 0x20 && controlId <= 0x27) {
+   833‚Üí      return `Bot ${controlId - 0x20 + 1}`;
+   834‚Üí    } else if (controlId >= 0x28 && controlId <= 0x3F) {
+   835‚Üí      return `Btn ${controlId - 0x28 + 1}`;
+   836‚Üí    } else {
+   837‚Üí      return `Ctrl ${controlId}`;
+   838‚Üí    }
+   839‚Üí  }
+   840‚Üí
+   841‚Üí  /**
+   842‚Üí   * Build LED control message
+   843‚Üí   */
+   844‚Üí  static buildLedControl(controlId: number, color: number, behaviour: 'static' | 'flash' | 'pulse' | 'flashing' | 'pulsing' = 'static'): number[] {
+   845‚Üí    if (controlId < 0 || controlId > 127) {
+   846‚Üí      throw new Error('Control ID must be 0-127');
+   847‚Üí    }
+   848‚Üí
+   849‚Üí    if (color < 0 || color > 127) {
+   850‚Üí      throw new Error('Color must be 0-127');
+   851‚Üí    }
+   852‚Üí
+   853‚Üí    let behaviorByte = color;
+   854‚Üí
+   855‚Üí    if (behaviour === 'flash' || behaviour === 'flashing') {
+   856‚Üí      behaviorByte |= 0x08;
+   857‚Üí    } else if (behaviour === 'pulse' || behaviour === 'pulsing') {
+   858‚Üí      behaviorByte |= 0x10;
+   859‚Üí    }
+   860‚Üí
+   861‚Üí    return [
+   862‚Üí      0xF0, // SysEx start
+   863‚Üí      ...MANUFACTURER_ID,
+   864‚Üí      0x11, // Device ID
+   865‚Üí      SysExMessageType.LED_CONTROL,
+   866‚Üí      controlId,
+   867‚Üí      behaviorByte,
+   868‚Üí      0xF7, // SysEx end
+   869‚Üí    ];
+   870‚Üí  }
+   871‚Üí
+   872‚Üí  /**
+   873‚Üí   * Build LED reset message
+   874‚Üí   */
+   875‚Üí  static buildLedReset(): number[] {
+   876‚Üí    return [
+   877‚Üí      0xF0, // SysEx start
+   878‚Üí      ...MANUFACTURER_ID,
+   879‚Üí      0x11, // Device ID
+   880‚Üí      SysExMessageType.RESET_LED,
+   881‚Üí      0x00, // Reset all LEDs
+   882‚Üí      0xF7, // SysEx end
+   883‚Üí    ];
+   884‚Üí  }
+   885‚Üí
+   886‚Üí  /**
+   887‚Üí   * Check if SysEx message is a device inquiry response
+   888‚Üí   *
+   889‚Üí   * This validates the fourth message in the 4-message handshake protocol.
+   890‚Üí   * Device inquiry responses follow the Universal Non-Realtime format.
+   891‚Üí   *
+   892‚Üí   * Expected format: F0 7E [device_id] 06 02 [manufacturer_id] [device_info] F7
+   893‚Üí   *
+   894‚Üí   * @param {number[]} data - Raw SysEx message bytes including F0/F7
+   895‚Üí   * @returns {boolean} True if message is a valid device inquiry response
+   896‚Üí   */
+   897‚Üí  static isDeviceInquiryResponse(data: number[]): boolean {
+   898‚Üí    // Minimum length check (F0 7E XX 06 02 + at least 3 bytes manufacturer ID + F7)
+   899‚Üí    if (data.length < 9) {
+   900‚Üí      return false;
+   901‚Üí    }
+   902‚Üí
+   903‚Üí    // Validate SysEx start and end bytes
+   904‚Üí    if (data[0] !== 0xF0 || data[data.length - 1] !== 0xF7) {
+   905‚Üí      return false;
+   906‚Üí    }
+   907‚Üí
+   908‚Üí    // Check Universal Non-Realtime header
+   909‚Üí    if (data[1] !== 0x7E) {
+   910‚Üí      return false;
+   911‚Üí    }
+   912‚Üí
+   913‚Üí    // Device ID can be any value (data[2])
+   914‚Üí
+   915‚Üí    // Check Sub-ID1 (General Information)
+   916‚Üí    if (data[3] !== 0x06) {
+   917‚Üí      return false;
+   918‚Üí    }
+   919‚Üí
+   920‚Üí    // Check Sub-ID2 (Identity Reply)
+   921‚Üí    if (data[4] !== 0x02) {
+   922‚Üí      return false;
+   923‚Üí    }
+   924‚Üí
+   925‚Üí    // Must have at least manufacturer ID (3 bytes minimum)
+   926‚Üí    if (data.length < 9) {
+   927‚Üí      return false;
+   928‚Üí    }
+   929‚Üí
+   930‚Üí    return true;
+   931‚Üí  }
+   932‚Üí
+   933‚Üí  /**
+   934‚Üí   * Check if data is a valid SysEx message
+   935‚Üí   */
+   936‚Üí  static isValidSysEx(data: number[]): boolean {
+   937‚Üí    if (data.length < 3) {
+   938‚Üí      return false;
+   939‚Üí    }
+   940‚Üí
+   941‚Üí    return data[0] === 0xF0 && data[data.length - 1] === 0xF7;
+   942‚Üí  }
+   943‚Üí
+   944‚Üí  /**
+   945‚Üí   * Extract manufacturer ID from SysEx message
+   946‚Üí   */
+   947‚Üí  static getManufacturerId(data: number[]): number[] | null {
+   948‚Üí    if (!this.isValidSysEx(data)) {
+   949‚Üí      return null;
+   950‚Üí    }
+   951‚Üí
+   952‚Üí    // Universal messages don't have manufacturer ID
+   953‚Üí    const manufacturerByte = data[1];
+   954‚Üí    if (manufacturerByte === undefined) {
+   955‚Üí      return null;
+   956‚Üí    }
+   957‚Üí
+   958‚Üí    if (manufacturerByte === 0x7E || manufacturerByte === 0x7F) {
+   959‚Üí      return null;
+   960‚Üí    }
+   961‚Üí
+   962‚Üí    // Extract 3-byte manufacturer ID
+   963‚Üí    if (manufacturerByte === 0x00) {
+   964‚Üí      return data.slice(1, 4);
+   965‚Üí    }
+   966‚Üí
+   967‚Üí    // Single byte manufacturer ID
+   968‚Üí    return [manufacturerByte];
+   969‚Üí  }
+   970‚Üí}
+   971‚Üí
+   972‚Üíexport default SysExParser;
+```

+   123‚Üí  async readMode(slot: CustomModeSlot): Promise<CustomMode> {
+   124‚Üí    this.validateSlot(slot);
+   125‚Üí
+   126‚Üí    // Check if we have a pending operation for this slot
+   127‚Üí    const pending = this.pendingOperations.get(slot);
+   128‚Üí    if (pending) {
+   129‚Üí      return pending;
+   130‚Üí    }
+   131‚Üí
+   132‚Üí    // Check cache
+   133‚Üí    const cached = this.getCachedMode(slot);
+   134‚Üí    if (cached) {
+   135‚Üí      return cached;
+   136‚Üí    }
+   137‚Üí
+   138‚Üí    // Create read operation
+   139‚Üí    const operation = this.performReadMode(slot);
+   140‚Üí    this.pendingOperations.set(slot, operation);
+   141‚Üí
+   142‚Üí    try {
+   143‚Üí      const mode = await operation;
+   144‚Üí      this.cacheMode(slot, mode);
+   145‚Üí      this.emit('mode:loaded', slot, mode);
+   146‚Üí      return mode;
+   147‚Üí    } finally {
+   148‚Üí      this.pendingOperations.delete(slot);
+   149‚Üí    }
+   150‚Üí  }

+   187‚Üí      controls: {},
+   188‚Üí      leds: new Map(),
+   189‚Üí      metadata: {
+   190‚Üí        slot,
+   191‚Üí        createdAt: new Date(),
+   192‚Üí        modifiedAt: new Date(),
+   193‚Üí      }
+   194‚Üí    };
+   195‚Üí
+   196‚Üí    // Parse control mappings
+   197‚Üí    if (response.controls) {
+   198‚Üí      for (const control of response.controls) {
+   199‚Üí        const controlId = this.getControlIdName(control.controlId);
+   200‚Üí        if (controlId) {
+   201‚Üí          mode.controls[controlId] = {
+   202‚Üí            type: this.getControlType(control.controlId),
+   203‚Üí            channel: control.channel,
+   204‚Üí            cc: control.ccNumber,
+   205‚Üí            min: control.minValue,
+   206‚Üí            max: control.maxValue,
+   207‚Üí            behaviour: control.behaviour as ControlBehaviour,
+   208‚Üí          };
+   209‚Üí        }
+   210‚Üí      }
+   211‚Üí    }
+   212‚Üí
+   213‚Üí    // Parse LED mappings
+   214‚Üí    if (response.colors) {
+   215‚Üí      for (const color of response.colors) {
+   216‚Üí        const controlId = this.getControlIdName(color.controlId);
+   217‚Üí        if (controlId && mode.leds) {
+   218‚Üí          mode.leds.set(color.controlId, {
+   219‚Üí            color: color.color,
+   220‚Üí            behaviour: color.behaviour ?? 'static',
+   221‚Üí          });
+   222‚Üí        }
+   223‚Üí      }
+   224‚Üí    }
+   225‚Üí
+   226‚Üí    return mode;
+   227‚Üí  }
+   228‚Üí
+   229‚Üí  /**
+   230‚Üí   * Convert custom mode to device format
+   231‚Üí   */
+   232‚Üí  private convertToDeviceFormat(slot: number, mode: CustomMode): CustomMode {
+   233‚Üí    const controls: ControlMapping[] = [];
+   234‚Üí    const colors: ColorMapping[] = [];
+   235‚Üí
+   236‚Üí    // Convert control mappings
+   237‚Üí    for (const [key, control] of Object.entries(mode.controls)) {
+   238‚Üí      const controlId = this.getControlIdValue(key);
+   239‚Üí      if (controlId !== undefined) {
+   240‚Üí        const ctrl = control as any;
+   241‚Üí        controls.push({
+   242‚Üí          controlId,
+   243‚Üí          channel: ctrl.channel,
+   244‚Üí          ccNumber: ctrl.cc,
+   245‚Üí          minValue: ctrl.min,
+   246‚Üí          maxValue: ctrl.max,
+   247‚Üí          behaviour: ctrl.behaviour,
+   248‚Üí        });
+   249‚Üí      }
+   250‚Üí    }
+   251‚Üí
+   252‚Üí    // Convert LED mappings
+   253‚Üí    for (const [key, led] of Object.entries(mode.leds || {})) {
+   254‚Üí      const controlId = this.getControlIdValue(key);
+   255‚Üí      if (controlId !== undefined) {
+   256‚Üí        const ledConfig = led as any;
+   257‚Üí        colors.push({
+   258‚Üí          controlId,
+   259‚Üí          color: ledConfig.color as number,
+   260‚Üí          behaviour: ledConfig.behaviour,
+   261‚Üí        });
+   262‚Üí      }
+   263‚Üí    }
+   264‚Üí
+   265‚Üí    return {
+   266‚Üí      slot,
+   267‚Üí      name: mode.name,
+   268‚Üí      controls,
+   269‚Üí      colors,
+   270‚Üí    } as any;
+   271‚Üí  }
+   272‚Üí
+   273‚Üí  /**
+   274‚Üí   * Get control ID value from name
+   275‚Üí   */
+   276‚Üí  private getControlIdValue(name: string): number | undefined {
+   277‚Üí    return (CONTROL_IDS as any)[name];
+   278‚Üí  }
+   279‚Üí
+   280‚Üí  /**
+   281‚Üí   * Get control ID name from value
+   282‚Üí   */
+   283‚Üí  private getControlIdName(value: number): string | undefined {
+   284‚Üí    for (const [key, val] of Object.entries(CONTROL_IDS)) {
+   285‚Üí      if (val === value) {
+   286‚Üí        return key;
+   287‚Üí      }
+   288‚Üí    }
+   289‚Üí    return undefined;
+   290‚Üí  }
+   291‚Üí
+   292‚Üí  /**
+   293‚Üí   * Get control type from control ID
+   294‚Üí   */
+   295‚Üí  private getControlType(controlId: number): ControlType {
+   296‚Üí    if (controlId >= 0x0D && controlId <= 0x38) {
+   297‚Üí      return 'knob';
+   298‚Üí    } else if (controlId >= 0x4D && controlId <= 0x54) {
+   299‚Üí      return 'fader';
+   300‚Üí    } else {
+   301‚Üí      return 'button';
+   302‚Üí    }
+   303‚Üí  }
+   304‚Üí
+   305‚Üí  /**
+   306‚Üí   * Sync all modes from device
+   307‚Üí   */
+   308‚Üí  async syncAllModes(): Promise<CustomMode[]> {
+   309‚Üí    const modes: CustomMode[] = [];
+   310‚Üí
+   311‚Üí    for (let slot = 0; slot < 16; slot++) {
+   312‚Üí      try {
+   313‚Üí        const mode = await this.readMode(slot as CustomModeSlot);
+   314‚Üí        modes.push(mode);
+   315‚Üí      } catch (error) {
+   316‚Üí        // Log error but continue syncing other slots
+   317‚Üí        console.error(`Failed to read mode from slot ${slot}:`, error);
+   318‚Üí      }
+   319‚Üí    }
+   320‚Üí
+   321‚Üí    return modes;
+   322‚Üí  }
+   323‚Üí
+   324‚Üí  /**
+   325‚Üí   * Copy a mode from one slot to another
+   326‚Üí   */
+   327‚Üí  async copyMode(sourceSlot: CustomModeSlot, targetSlot: CustomModeSlot): Promise<void> {
+   328‚Üí    const sourceMode = await this.readMode(sourceSlot);
+   329‚Üí
+   330‚Üí    // Create a copy with new metadata
+   331‚Üí    const targetMode: CustomMode = {
+   332‚Üí      ...sourceMode,
+   333‚Üí      metadata: {
+   334‚Üí        ...sourceMode.metadata,
+   335‚Üí        slot: targetSlot,
+   336‚Üí        modifiedAt: new Date(),
+   337‚Üí      }
+   338‚Üí    };
+   339‚Üí
+   340‚Üí    await this.writeMode(targetSlot, targetMode);
+   341‚Üí  }
+   342‚Üí
+   343‚Üí  /**
+   344‚Üí   * Create a default mode
+   345‚Üí   */
+   346‚Üí  createDefaultMode(name?: string): CustomMode {
+   347‚Üí    const mode: CustomMode = {
+   348‚Üí      name: name || 'Default Mode',
+   349‚Üí      controls: {},
+   350‚Üí      leds: new Map(),
+   351‚Üí      metadata: {
+   352‚Üí        createdAt: new Date(),
+   353‚Üí        modifiedAt: new Date(),
+   354‚Üí      }
+   355‚Üí    };
+   356‚Üí
+   357‚Üí    // Setup default control mappings
+   358‚Üí    // Send A knobs - CC 13-20
+   359‚Üí    for (let i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
+   360‚Üí      const key = `SEND_A${i + 1}`;
+   361‚Üí      mode.controls[key] = {
+   362‚Üí        type: 'knob',
+   363‚Üí        channel: 0,
+   364‚Üí        cc: 13 + i,
+   365‚Üí        min: 0,
+   366‚Üí        max: 127,
+   367‚Üí        behaviour: 'absolute',
+   368‚Üí      };
+   369‚Üí    }
+   370‚Üí
+   371‚Üí    // Send B knobs - CC 29-36
+   372‚Üí    for (let i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
+   373‚Üí      const key = `SEND_B${i + 1}`;
+   374‚Üí      mode.controls[key] = {
+   375‚Üí        type: 'knob',
+   376‚Üí        channel: 0,
+   377‚Üí        cc: 29 + i,
+   378‚Üí        min: 0,
+   379‚Üí        max: 127,
+   380‚Üí        behaviour: 'absolute',
+   381‚Üí      };
+   382‚Üí    }
+   383‚Üí
+   384‚Üí    // Pan knobs - CC 49-56
+   385‚Üí    for (let i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
+   386‚Üí      const key = `PAN${i + 1}`;
+   387‚Üí      mode.controls[key] = {
+   388‚Üí        type: 'knob',
+   389‚Üí        channel: 0,
+   390‚Üí        cc: 49 + i,
+   391‚Üí        min: 0,
+   392‚Üí        max: 127,
+   393‚Üí        behaviour: 'absolute',
+   394‚Üí      };
+   395‚Üí    }
+   396‚Üí
+   397‚Üí    // Faders - CC 77-84
+   398‚Üí    for (let i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
+   399‚Üí      const key = `FADER${i + 1}`;
+   400‚Üí      mode.controls[key] = {
+   401‚Üí        type: 'fader',
+   402‚Üí        channel: 0,
+   403‚Üí        cc: 77 + i,
+   404‚Üí        min: 0,
+   405‚Üí        max: 127,
+   406‚Üí        behaviour: 'absolute',
+   407‚Üí      };
+   408‚Üí    }
+   409‚Üí
+   410‚Üí    // Setup default LED colors
+   411‚Üí    for (let i = 0; i < 8; i++) {
+   412‚Üí      mode.leds!.set(i + 0x10, { // Focus buttons start at 0x10
+   413‚Üí        color: LED_COLORS.AMBER_LOW as any,
+   414‚Üí        behaviour: 'static',
+   415‚Üí      });
+   416‚Üí
+   417‚Üí      mode.leds!.set(i + 0x28, { // Control buttons start at 0x28
+   418‚Üí        color: LED_COLORS.GREEN_LOW as any,
+   419‚Üí        behaviour: 'static',
+   420‚Üí      });
+   421‚Üí    }
+   422‚Üí
+   423‚Üí    return mode;
+   424‚Üí  }
+   425‚Üí
+   426‚Üí  /**
+   427‚Üí   * Export mode to JSON
+   428‚Üí   */
+   429‚Üí  exportMode(mode: CustomMode): string {
+   430‚Üí    return JSON.stringify(mode, null, 2);
+   431‚Üí  }
+   432‚Üí
+   433‚Üí  /**
+   434‚Üí   * Import mode from JSON
+   435‚Üí   */
+   436‚Üí  importMode(json: string): CustomMode {
+   437‚Üí    const parsed = JSON.parse(json);
+   438‚Üí    this.validateMode(parsed);
+   439‚Üí    return parsed;
+   440‚Üí  }
+   441‚Üí
+   442‚Üí  /**
+   443‚Üí   * Validate slot number
+   444‚Üí   */
+   445‚Üí  private validateSlot(slot: number): void {
+   446‚Üí    if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
+   447‚Üí      throw new Error(`Invalid slot number: ${slot}. Must be 0-15.`);
+   448‚Üí    }
+   449‚Üí  }
+   450‚Üí
+   451‚Üí  /**
+   452‚Üí   * Validate custom mode
+   453‚Üí   */
+   454‚Üí  private validateMode(mode: CustomMode): void {
+   455‚Üí    if (!mode.name || typeof mode.name !== 'string') {
+   456‚Üí      throw new Error('Mode must have a name');
+   457‚Üí    }
+   458‚Üí
+   459‚Üí    if (!mode.controls || typeof mode.controls !== 'object') {
+   460‚Üí      throw new Error('Mode must have controls object');
+   461‚Üí    }
+   462‚Üí
+   463‚Üí    // Validate each control mapping
+   464‚Üí    for (const [key, control] of Object.entries(mode.controls)) {
+   465‚Üí      if (!this.getControlIdValue(key)) {
+   466‚Üí        throw new Error(`Invalid control ID: ${key}`);
+   467‚Üí      }
+   468‚Üí
+   469‚Üí      const ctrl = control as any; // Type assertion for validation
+   470‚Üí
+   471‚Üí      if (ctrl.channel < 0 || ctrl.channel > 15) {
+   472‚Üí        throw new Error(`Invalid channel for ${key}: ${ctrl.channel}`);
+   473‚Üí      }
+   474‚Üí
+   475‚Üí      if (ctrl.cc !== undefined && (ctrl.cc < 0 || ctrl.cc > 127)) {
+   476‚Üí        throw new Error(`Invalid CC for ${key}: ${ctrl.cc}`);
+   477‚Üí      }
+   478‚Üí
+   479‚Üí      if (ctrl.min !== undefined && (ctrl.min < 0 || ctrl.min > 127)) {
+   480‚Üí        throw new Error(`Invalid min value for ${key}: ${ctrl.min}`);
+   481‚Üí      }
+   482‚Üí
+   483‚Üí      if (ctrl.max !== undefined && (ctrl.max < 0 || ctrl.max > 127)) {
+   484‚Üí        throw new Error(`Invalid max value for ${key}: ${ctrl.max}`);
+   485‚Üí      }
+   486‚Üí
+   487‚Üí      if (ctrl.min !== undefined && ctrl.max !== undefined && ctrl.min > ctrl.max) {
+   488‚Üí        throw new Error(`Min value greater than max for ${key}`);
+   489‚Üí      }
+   490‚Üí    }
+   491‚Üí
+   492‚Üí    // Validate LED mappings if present
+   493‚Üí    if (mode.leds) {
+   494‚Üí      for (const [key, led] of Object.entries(mode.leds)) {
+   495‚Üí        if (!this.getControlIdValue(key)) {
+   496‚Üí          throw new Error(`Invalid LED control ID: ${key}`);
+   497‚Üí        }
+   498‚Üí
+   499‚Üí        const ledConfig = led as any; // Type assertion for validation
+   500‚Üí        const validBehaviours = ['static', 'flash', 'pulse'];
+   501‚Üí        if (ledConfig.behaviour && !validBehaviours.includes(ledConfig.behaviour)) {
+   502‚Üí          throw new Error(`Invalid LED behaviour for ${key}: ${ledConfig.behaviour}`);
+   503‚Üí        }
+   504‚Üí      }
+   505‚Üí    }
+   506‚Üí  }
+   507‚Üí
+   508‚Üí  /**
+   509‚Üí   * Get cached mode
+   510‚Üí   */
+   511‚Üí  private getCachedMode(slot: number): CustomMode | null {
+   512‚Üí    const cached = this.modeCache.get(slot);
+   513‚Üí
+   514‚Üí    if (!cached) {
+   515‚Üí      return null;
+   516‚Üí    }
+   517‚Üí
+   518‚Üí    // Check if cache has expired
+   519‚Üí    const now = Date.now();
+   520‚Üí    if (now - cached.timestamp > this.options.cacheTimeout) {
+   521‚Üí      this.modeCache.delete(slot);
+   522‚Üí      return null;
+   523‚Üí    }
+   524‚Üí
+   525‚Üí    return cached.mode;
+   526‚Üí  }
+   527‚Üí
+   528‚Üí  /**
+   529‚Üí   * Cache a mode
+   530‚Üí   */
+   531‚Üí  private cacheMode(slot: number, mode: CustomMode): void {
+   532‚Üí    this.modeCache.set(slot, {
+   533‚Üí      mode,
+   534‚Üí      timestamp: Date.now(),
+   535‚Üí    });
+   536‚Üí
+   537‚Üí    this.emit('cache:updated', slot);
+   538‚Üí  }
+   539‚Üí
+   540‚Üí  /**
+   541‚Üí   * Clear cache
+   542‚Üí   */
+   543‚Üí  clearCache(): void {
+   544‚Üí    this.modeCache.clear();
+   545‚Üí    this.emit('cache:cleared');
+   546‚Üí  }
+   547‚Üí
+   548‚Üí  /**
+   549‚Üí   * Get all cached modes
+   550‚Üí   */
+   551‚Üí  getCachedModes(): Map<number, CustomMode> {
+   552‚Üí    const modes = new Map<number, CustomMode>();
+   553‚Üí
+   554‚Üí    for (const [slot, cached] of this.modeCache.entries()) {
+   555‚Üí      const now = Date.now();
+   556‚Üí      if (now - cached.timestamp <= this.options.cacheTimeout) {
+   557‚Üí        modes.set(slot, cached.mode);
+   558‚Üí      }
+   559‚Üí    }
+   560‚Üí
+   561‚Üí    return modes;
+   562‚Üí  }
+   563‚Üí
+   564‚Üí  /**
+   565‚Üí   * Clean up resources
+   566‚Üí   */
+   567‚Üí  cleanup(): void {
+   568‚Üí    this.clearCache();
+   569‚Üí    this.pendingOperations.clear();
+   570‚Üí    this.removeAllListeners();
+   571‚Üí  }
+   572‚Üí}
+   573‚Üí
+   574‚Üíexport default CustomModeManager;
+```

+/Users/orion/work/ol_dsp/modules/audio-control/modules/launch-control-xl3/docs/PROTOCOL.md-559-| 1.8 | 2025-10-11 | **Parser Bug Fix:** Removed incorrect 0x40 parsing in READ responses. The byte 0x40 appears as **data within 0x48 control structures** (minValue field at offset +7), not as a control marker. This caused wrong CC numbers, missing custom labels, and fake controls with CC 0. Only 0x48 markers are used for READ responses. Reference: GitHub issue #32 |
+/Users/orion/work/ol_dsp/modules/audio-control/modules/launch-control-xl3/docs/PROTOCOL.md:560:| 1.7 | 2025-10-09 | **MAJOR UPDATE:** Corrected page mapping documentation. Logical pages 0 and 1 map to SysEx page bytes 0x00 and 0x03. Removed extensive DAW port protocol documentation (deprecated). Clarified that slot selection uses SysEx slot byte directly. Updated all examples to reflect working code. |
+/Users/orion/work/ol_dsp/modules/audio-control/modules/launch-control-xl3/docs/PROTOCOL.md:561:| 1.6 | 2025-10-01 | **DEFINITIVE:** SysEx read/write DOES have slot parameter. Format is `F0 00 20 29 02 15 05 00 40 [PAGE] [SLOT] F7` where `[SLOT]` is slot number 0-14 (slot 15 reserved and immutable). DAW port protocol is NOT required for slot selection. |
+/Users/orion/work/ol_dsp/modules/audio-control/modules/launch-control-xl3/docs/PROTOCOL.md-562-| 1.5 | 2025-10-01 | **RETRACTED:** Incorrectly stated SysEx has no slot parameter. |

+
+## Key Findings:
+
+1. **The Problem**: Device firmware rejects writes to inactive slots with status code 0x9
+   - Software correctly constructs SysEx write message with slot parameter
+   - Device responds with acknowledgement status 0x9 (rejection) for inactive slots
+   - Device only accepts writes to the currently active slot or slot 0
+
+2. **Current Protocol Understanding**:
+   - SysEx write format: `F0 00 20 29 02 15 05 00 45 [page] [slot] [...data...] F7`
+   - Slot byte is included in write messages (protocol v1.6+)
+   - DAW port protocol was removed (deemed unnecessary for slot selection)
+   - Template selection exists via command 0x77: `F0 00 20 29 02 11 77 [slot] F7`
+
+3. **Template Selection (0x77)**:
+   - DeviceManager has `selectTemplate(slot)` method
+   - Uses SysExParser.buildTemplateChange(slot)
+   - Format: `F0 ... 02 11 77 [slot] F7`
+   - This is different from write command (0x45)
+
+4. **Hypothesis**:
+   The device may require template/slot to be selected BEFORE writing to that slot. The 0x77 command appears to be for slot selection/activation, which would allow subsequent 0x45 writes to succeed.
+
+5. **Investigation Strategy**:
+   - Phase 1: Capture MIDI traffic when web editor writes to different slots
+   - Phase 2: Test if 0x77 command precedes 0x45 writes
+   - Phase 3: Implement programmatic slot selection before write
+   - Phase 4: Test cross-slot operations

+   - Does NOT mention template selection (0x77) requirement
+   - Deprecated DAW port protocol (line 487-500)
+
+### Root Cause Hypothesis:
+The device requires **two-step process**:
+1. Select target slot via template change (0x77)
+2. Then write to that slot (0x45)
+
+Current implementation only does step 2.

+Tool use: **Write**
+
+```md
+# Issue #36: Device Firmware Slot Rejection - Diagnostic Workplan
+
+**Issue**: Launch Control XL3: Device firmware rejects writes to inactive slots (status 0x9)
+**Status**: Investigation Phase
+**Created**: 2025-10-12
+**Branch**: `issues/36-slot-rejection`
+**Severity**: High - Core functionality blocked
+
+---
+
+## Problem Statement
+
+### Summary
+
+The Novation Launch Control XL3 device firmware **rejects write operations to slots that are not currently active** on the physical device, returning status code `0x9` (device rejection). This prevents programmatic multi-slot management from working, blocking core functionality in the xl3-web application.
+
+### Impact
+
+**Functionality Blocked**:
+- Users cannot copy modes between slots programmatically
+- Multi-slot management from web UI is non-functional
+- Limits device to effectively one user-programmable slot at a time
+- Defeats purpose of 15-slot architecture for remote management
+
+**Data Integrity**: Safe - Device rejects invalid operations cleanly (no corruption risk)
+
+### Environment
+
+- **Device**: Novation Launch Control XL3 (Serial: LX280935400469)
+- **Firmware**: v1.0.10.84
+- **Library**: @oletizi/launch-control-xl3 v1.20.2
+- **Web App**: xl3-web v0.1.0
+- **Related Issue**: oletizi/xl3-web#4
+
+---
+
+## Analysis & Evidence
+
+### Code Review Findings
+
+#### 1. Acknowledgement Handling (DeviceManager.ts)
+
+**Location**: `src/device/DeviceManager.ts:70, 441-451`
+
+\```typescript
+// Line 70: Acknowledgement tracking
+private pendingAcknowledgements = new Map<number, {
+  resolve: () => void;
+  reject: (error: Error) => void;
+  timeout: NodeJS.Timeout;
+}>();
+
+// Line 441-451: Acknowledgement handler
+case 'write_acknowledgement':
+  const ack = parsed as any;
+  const pending = this.pendingAcknowledgements.get(ack.page);
+  if (pending) {
+    clearTimeout(pending.timeout);
+    this.pendingAcknowledgements.delete(ack.page);
+    if (ack.status === 0x06) {
+      pending.resolve();  // Success
+    } else {
+      pending.reject(new Error(`Write failed for page ${ack.page}: status 0x${ack.status.toString(16)}`));
+    }
+  }
+  break;
+\```
+
+**Observations**:
+- Handles write acknowledgements correctly
+- Distinguishes between success (0x06) and rejection (0x09)
+- **Missing**: No handling for slot selection acknowledgements
+- Only tracks page-level operations, not slot-level state
+
+#### 2. Template Selection Implementation (DeviceManager.ts)
+
+**Location**: `src/device/DeviceManager.ts:520-535`
+
+\```typescript
+/**
+ * Select a template slot (0-15)
+ */
+async selectTemplate(slot: number): Promise<void> {
+  if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
+    throw new Error('Template slot must be 0-15');
+  }
+
+  // Send template change message
+  const message = SysExParser.buildTemplateChange(slot);
+  await this.sendSysEx(message);
+
+  this.currentMode = {
+    type: 'template',
+    slot,
+  };
+
+  this.emit('device:modeChanged', this.currentMode);
+}
+\```
+
+**Observations**:
+- **Template selection command EXISTS** (command 0x77)
+- Format: `F0 00 20 29 02 11 77 [slot] F7`
+- **CRITICAL**: Method exists but is **NEVER called before writes**
+- Only called during device initialization (selectTemplate(0))
+- No acknowledgement wait implemented
+
+#### 3. Write Implementation (DeviceManager.ts)
+
+**Location**: `src/device/DeviceManager.ts:591-606`
+
+\```typescript
+/**
+ * Write custom mode to device
+ */
+async writeCustomMode(slot: number, mode: CustomMode): Promise<void> {
+  if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
+    throw new Error('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');
+  }
+
+  const modeData = {
+    slot,
+    name: mode.name,
+    controls: mode.controls,
+    colors: mode.colors,
+  };
+
+  const validatedModeData = this.validateCustomModeData(modeData);
+  const message = SysExParser.buildCustomModeWriteRequest(slot, validatedModeData);
+  await this.sendSysEx(message);
+}
+\```
+
+**Observations**:
+- Goes **directly to write** without slot pre-selection
+- Includes slot parameter in SysEx message (correct per protocol)
+- **Missing**: No call to `selectTemplate(slot)` before write
+- **Missing**: No acknowledgement wait for slot selection
+
+#### 4. SysEx Parser (SysExParser.ts)
+
+**Location**: `src/core/SysExParser.ts:520-533, 674-686`
+
+\```typescript
+// Template change builder
+static buildTemplateChange(templateNumber: number): number[] {
+  if (templateNumber < 0 || templateNumber > 15) {
+    throw new Error('Template number must be 0-15');
+  }
+
+  return [
+    0xF0, // SysEx start
+    ...MANUFACTURER_ID,
+    0x11, // Device ID (Launch Control XL)
+    SysExMessageType.TEMPLATE_CHANGE, // 0x77
+    templateNumber,
+    0xF7, // SysEx end
+  ];
+}
+
+// Write request builder
+static buildCustomModeWriteRequest(slot: number, modeData: CustomModeMessage): number[] {
+  // ... validation ...
+
+  return [
+    0xF0,             // SysEx start
+    0x00, 0x20, 0x29, // Manufacturer ID (Novation)
+    0x02,             // Device ID (Launch Control XL 3)
+    0x15,             // Command (Custom mode)
+    0x05,             // Sub-command
+    0x00,             // Reserved
+    0x45,             // Write operation
+    slot,             // Slot number (0-14)
+    ...encodedData,   // Encoded custom mode data
+    0xF7              // SysEx end
+  ];
+}
+\```
+
+**Observations**:
+- Both commands correctly implemented
+- Template change uses device ID 0x11, command 0x77
+- Write uses device ID 0x02, command 0x45
+- **No parsing for template change acknowledgements**
+
+#### 5. Protocol Documentation (PROTOCOL.md)
+
+**Location**: `docs/PROTOCOL.md:60-89, 487-500`
+
+**Current Documentation States**:
+> "Slot Selection (via SysEx slot byte parameter)
+> Simply include the target slot number (0-14) in the SysEx read request"
+
+**Critical Gap**:
+- Documentation assumes slot byte is sufficient
+- **Does NOT mention template selection requirement**
+- No reference to 0x77 command for writes
+- Deprecated DAW port protocol (but template selection different)
+
+### Issue Evidence from xl3-web
+
+**Automated Test Results** (from issue description):
+
+\```javascript
+[LOG] === SEND DIAGNOSTIC ===
+[LOG] 1. activeSlotIndex: 3                              ‚úÖ CORRECT
+[LOG] 2. activeSlotIndex type: number                    ‚úÖ CORRECT
+[LOG] 3. mode.name: Cutoffj                             ‚úÖ CORRECT
+[LOG] 6. converted mode name: Cutoffj                    ‚úÖ CORRECT
+[LOG] 7. converted controls count: 48                    ‚úÖ CORRECT
+
+[ERROR] Send error: Error: Write failed for page 0: status 0x9
+    at DeviceManager.handleSysExMessage
+\```
+
+**Software Stack Verification**:
+- ‚úÖ Web App - Correctly passes slot parameter
+- ‚úÖ Library API - Device.saveCustomMode(slot, mode) receives correct slot
+- ‚úÖ SysEx Builder - buildCustomModeWriteRequest(slot, page, data) uses variable slot
+- ‚úÖ Message Transmission - SysEx message sent successfully to device
+- ‚ùå Device Firmware - Rejects write with status 0x9
+
+### Device Behavior Analysis
+
+**Observed Pattern**:
+- Writing to **currently active slot**: ‚úÖ Success (status 0x06)
+- Writing to **slot 0**: ‚úÖ Success (default/fallback slot)
+- Writing to **inactive slot**: ‚ùå Rejection (status 0x09)
+
+**Hypothesis**:
+The firmware only accepts writes to:
+1. The currently active slot on the physical device, OR
+2. Slot 0 (special default slot)
+
+This explains why:
+- BUG-001 (hardcoded slot 0) "worked" initially
+- BUG-001 fix passed verification (only tested slot 0 writes)
+- Cross-slot operations fail (device rejects inactive slot writes)
+
+---
+
+## Root Cause Hypothesis
+
+### Primary Hypothesis: Missing Slot Pre-Selection
+
+**Theory**: The device requires a **2-phase write protocol**:
+
+\```
+Phase 1: Select Target Slot
+  Command: F0 00 20 29 02 11 77 [slot] F7
+  Purpose: Activate the target slot on device
+
+Phase 2: Write to Selected Slot
+  Command: F0 00 20 29 02 15 05 00 45 [page] [slot] [data] F7
+  Purpose: Write mode data to now-active slot
+\```
+
+**Current Implementation**: Only executes Phase 2
+
+**Evidence Supporting This Hypothesis**:
+1. Template selection command exists but unused before writes
+2. Device accepts writes to "active" slot (whatever is currently selected)
+3. Slot 0 works because it's default/always active
+4. Web editor likely sends 0x77 before 0x45 (needs verification)
+
+### Alternative Hypotheses (Lower Confidence)
+
+**Hypothesis B: Timing Issue**
+- Device needs time to process slot parameter
+- Rapid write after slot change causes rejection
+- **Likelihood**: Low - status 0x09 is explicit rejection, not timeout
+
+**Hypothesis C: Firmware Bug**
+- Device firmware incorrectly validates slot parameter
+- SysEx slot byte should work but doesn't
+- **Likelihood**: Low - too many users would report this
+
+**Hypothesis D: Undocumented Protocol Requirement**
+- Additional handshake step required
+- Missing secret command or parameter
+- **Likelihood**: Medium - but template selection is most obvious candidate
+
+---
+

+## Implementation Plan
+
+### Phase 4: Slot Selection Wrapper Implementation (Priority: HIGH)
+
+**Duration**: 2-3 hours
+**Goal**: Add programmatic slot selection before writes
+
+**Approach**: Modify existing write flow to include slot pre-selection
+
+#### Changes Required
+
+**File**: `src/device/DeviceManager.ts`
+
+**Location**: `writeCustomMode()` method (line 591)
+
+**Implementation**:
+
+\```typescript
+/**
+ * Write custom mode to device
+ *
+ * UPDATED: Now includes slot pre-selection to ensure device accepts write
+ */
+async writeCustomMode(slot: number, mode: CustomMode): Promise<void> {
+  if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
+    throw new Error('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');
+  }
+
+  // NEW: Phase 1 - Select target slot
+  console.log(`[DeviceManager] Selecting slot ${slot} before write`);
+  await this.selectTemplate(slot);
+
+  // NEW: Phase 1.5 - Wait for device to acknowledge slot selection
+  // (Implementation depends on Phase 3 findings)
+  await this.waitForSlotSelection(slot);
+
+  // EXISTING: Phase 2 - Write to now-active slot
+  const modeData = {
+    slot,
+    name: mode.name,
+    controls: mode.controls,
+    colors: mode.colors,
+  };
+
+  const validatedModeData = this.validateCustomModeData(modeData);
+  const message = SysExParser.buildCustomModeWriteRequest(slot, validatedModeData);
+  await this.sendSysEx(message);
+}
+
+/**
+ * Wait for device to acknowledge slot selection
+ *
+ * NEW METHOD: Ensures device has switched slots before write
+ */
+private async waitForSlotSelection(slot: number): Promise<void> {
+  // Implementation option A: Fixed delay (simple, may be fragile)
+  await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 100)); // 100ms
+
+  // Implementation option B: Wait for acknowledgement (robust, complex)
+  // return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
+  //   const timeout = setTimeout(() => {
+  //     reject(new Error(`Slot selection timeout for slot ${slot}`));
+  //   }, 1000);
+  //
+  //   this.once('device:modeChanged', (mode) => {
+  //     if (mode.slot === slot) {
+  //       clearTimeout(timeout);
+  //       resolve();
+  //     }
+  //   });
+  // });
+}
+\```
+
+**Decision Point**: Fixed Delay vs. Acknowledgement Wait
+
+**Option A: Fixed Delay** (RECOMMENDED for MVP)
+- **Pros**: Simple, requires no protocol changes
+- **Cons**: May be too slow (waste time) or too fast (race condition)
+- **Implementation**: 100ms delay (conservative)
+
+**Option B: Acknowledgement Wait** (IDEAL for production)
+- **Pros**: Robust, optimal timing, error detection
+- **Cons**: Requires Phase 3 completion, more complex
+- **Implementation**: Event-based wait with timeout
+
+**Recommendation**: Start with Option A (fixed delay) for initial testing, refine to Option B if needed.
+
+#### Additional Changes
+
+**File**: `src/device/DeviceManager.ts`
+**Enhancement**: Update template change handler
+
+\```typescript
+// EXISTING (line 387-394)
+case 'template_change':
+  const templateChange = this.validateTemplateChangeResponse(parsed);
+  this.currentMode = {
+    type: 'template',
+    slot: templateChange.templateNumber,
+  };
+  this.emit('device:modeChanged', this.currentMode);
+  break;
+
+// ENHANCED: Add to setupMidiHandlers() to receive during initialization
+this.midi.on('sysex', (message: MidiMessage) => {
+  // Remove isInitializing check for template_change messages
+  this.emit('sysex:received', message.data);
+  this.handleSysExMessage([...message.data]);
+});
+\```
+
+**Rationale**: Template change responses should be handled even during writes, not just initialization.
+

+### Files to Update

+#### 1. PROTOCOL.md
+
+**Location**: `modules/audio-control/modules/launch-control-xl3/docs/PROTOCOL.md`
+
+**Changes Required**:
+
+**Section to Add** (after line 188):
+
+\```markdown
+### Slot Selection for Writes
+
+**CRITICAL REQUIREMENT**: Before writing to any slot, the device MUST be instructed to select that slot via template change command.
+
+**Protocol Sequence**:
+\```
+Step 1: Select Target Slot
+  Message: F0 00 20 29 02 11 77 [slot] F7
+  Command: 0x77 (Template Change)
+  Purpose: Activate target slot on device
+
+Step 2: Wait for Device Response
+  Expected: Template change acknowledgement (format TBD)
+  Timing: ~24-50ms response time
+
+Step 3: Write to Selected Slot
+  Message: F0 00 20 29 02 15 05 00 45 [page] [slot] [data] F7
+  Command: 0x45 (Write)
+  Purpose: Write mode data to now-active slot
+\```
+
+**Why This is Required**:
+- Device firmware only accepts writes to the currently active slot
+- The slot parameter in the write message (0x45) is **not sufficient** alone
+- Template change (0x77) activates the slot and enables write operations
+
+**Example: Writing to Slot 3**:
+\```
+1. Send: F0 00 20 29 02 11 77 03 F7  (select slot 3)
+2. Wait: ~100ms for device to switch
+3. Send: F0 00 20 29 02 15 05 00 45 00 03 [data] F7  (write page 0 to slot 3)
+4. Wait: For acknowledgement (F0 00 20 29 02 15 05 00 15 00 06 F7)
+5. Send: F0 00 20 29 02 15 05 00 45 03 03 [data] F7  (write page 1 to slot 3)
+6. Wait: For acknowledgement
+\```
+
+**Error Handling**:
+- Writing without slot selection: Device returns status 0x09 (rejection)
+- Writing to slot 0: May work without selection (default/fallback slot)
+- Writing to slot 15: Reserved, immutable - always fails
+\```
+
+**Version History Entry**:
+\```markdown
+| 1.9 | 2025-10-12 | **Slot Selection Discovery:** Documented requirement for template change (0x77) before writes. Device rejects writes to inactive slots with status 0x09. Added complete write protocol sequence. Reference: GitHub issue #36 |
+\```
+
+---
+
+#### 2. ARCHITECTURE.md
+
+**Location**: `modules/audio-control/modules/launch-control-xl3/docs/ARCHITECTURE.md`
+
+**Section to Update**: "Write Flow" diagram
+
+**Add**:
+\```markdown
+### Custom Mode Write Flow (Updated 2025-10-12)
+
+\```
+‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
+‚îÇ  Application    ‚îÇ
+‚îÇ  Request Write  ‚îÇ
+‚îÇ  to Slot N      ‚îÇ
+‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
+         ‚îÇ
+         ‚Üì
+‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
+‚îÇ DeviceManager       ‚îÇ
+‚îÇ .writeCustomMode(N) ‚îÇ
+‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
+         ‚îÇ
+         ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí Phase 1: Slot Selection
+         ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí buildTemplateChange(N)
+         ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí Send 0x77 command
+         ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚Üí Wait for ACK/confirmation
+         ‚îÇ
+         ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí Phase 2: Write Page 0
+         ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí buildCustomModeWriteRequest(N, page=0)
+         ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí Send 0x45 command (page 0)
+         ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚Üí Wait for ACK (status 0x06)
+         ‚îÇ
+         ‚îî‚îÄ‚Üí Phase 3: Write Page 1
+             ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí buildCustomModeWriteRequest(N, page=1)
+             ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí Send 0x45 command (page 1)
+             ‚îî‚îÄ‚Üí Wait for ACK (status 0x06)
+\```
+
+**Key Changes (Issue #36 Fix)**:
+- Added Phase 1: Slot Selection via template change (0x77)
+- Device must acknowledge slot switch before write
+- Prevents status 0x09 rejection on inactive slots
+\```

+#### 3. API.md
+
+**Location**: `modules/audio-control/modules/launch-control-xl3/docs/API.md`
+
+**Update**: `writeCustomMode()` documentation
+
+\```markdown
+### writeCustomMode(slot, mode)
+
+Write a custom mode to the device.
+
+**IMPORTANT (v1.21.0+)**: This method now includes automatic slot selection. The device will physically switch to the target slot before writing. This may cause a brief visual indication on the device.
+
+**Parameters**:
+- `slot` (number): Target slot (0-14, slot 15 is reserved)
+- `mode` (CustomMode): Mode configuration to write
+
+**Behavior**:
+1. Sends template change command to select target slot
+2. Waits for device to acknowledge slot selection
+3. Writes mode data to now-active slot
+4. Returns after both pages written successfully
+
+**Timing**: Approximately 0.5-2.0 seconds depending on mode complexity
+
+**Throws**:
+- `Error`: If slot out of range (0-15)
+- `Error`: If slot selection times out
+- `Error`: If write fails (status !== 0x06)
+
+**Example**:
+\```typescript
+// Write to slot 3 (device will switch to slot 3)
+await device.writeCustomMode(3, myCustomMode);
+
+// Device is now on slot 3 after write completes
+\```
+
+**Historical Note**: Prior to v1.21.0, writes to inactive slots would fail with status 0x09. See GitHub issue #36.
+\```
+
+---
+
+#### 4. CHANGELOG.md
+
+**Location**: `modules/audio-control/modules/launch-control-xl3/CHANGELOG.md`
+
+**Add Entry**:
+
+\```markdown
+## [1.21.0] - 2025-10-12
+
+### Fixed
+- **Issue #36**: Device now accepts writes to inactive slots by implementing automatic slot selection
+  - Added template change (0x77) before write operations
+  - Device switches to target slot before writing
+  - Eliminates status 0x09 rejection errors
+  - Enables cross-slot operations in xl3-web application
+
+### Changed
+- `DeviceManager.writeCustomMode()` now includes slot pre-selection
+- Write operations may take slightly longer due to slot switching
+- Device physically changes slots during programmatic writes (visible on hardware)
+
+### Documentation
+- Updated PROTOCOL.md with slot selection requirement
+- Updated ARCHITECTURE.md with new write flow diagram
+- Enhanced API.md with timing and behavior notes
+\```
+
+---
+
+#### 5. Module README
+
+**Location**: `modules/audio-control/modules/launch-control-xl3/README.md`
+
+**Add Note** (in "Known Limitations" or similar section):
+
+\```markdown
+### Slot Selection Behavior
+
+When writing to a slot programmatically, the device will **physically switch** to that slot. This is required by the device firmware and cannot be avoided.
+
+**User Experience Note**: If writing to multiple slots in sequence, users will see the device's slot indicator change. This is normal behavior.
+
+**Workaround**: If you need to write to multiple slots without visual switching, there is currently no way to do this with the device firmware. Each write requires slot activation.
+\```

+## Risk Assessment
+
+### Technical Risks
+
+#### Low Risk ‚úÖ
+
+**Risk**: Implementation breaks existing functionality
+**Mitigation**:
+- Comprehensive test suite covers baseline scenarios
+- Changes are additive (slot selection before write)
+- No modification to existing protocol messages
+
+**Risk**: Performance degradation
+**Mitigation**:
+- Slot selection adds ~100-300ms (acceptable)
+- Total write time still < 3 seconds
+- Performance tests validate timing
+
+---
+
+#### Medium Risk ‚ö†Ô∏è
+
+**Risk**: Timing/synchronization issues between selection and write
+**Impact**: Intermittent failures, race conditions
+**Mitigation**:
+- Start with conservative fixed delay (100ms)
+- Add explicit acknowledgement wait if needed
+- Implement timeout error handling
+
+**Risk**: Unknown acknowledgement format for template changes
+**Impact**: Cannot reliably wait for slot selection
+**Mitigation**:
+- Phase 3 investigation identifies format
+- Fallback to fixed delay if no ACK
+- Use existing event system for template_change
+
+**Risk**: Device state management complexity
+**Impact**: Difficult to track current slot, synchronization issues
+**Mitigation**:
+- Use existing currentMode state tracking
+- Listen to template_change events
+- Add explicit state queries if needed
+
+---
+
+#### High Risk üö®
+
+**Risk**: Hypothesis is incorrect - slot selection doesn't solve the problem
+**Impact**: Wasted investigation time, need alternative solution
+**Mitigation**:
+- Phase 1 MIDI capture validates hypothesis early
+- Phase 2 empirical test confirms before full implementation
+- Alternative hypotheses documented (see below)
+
+---
+
+### Alternative Approaches
+
+If slot selection doesn't solve the problem:
+
+**Plan B: Require Manual Slot Selection**
+- Document that user must select slot on device before write
+- Add UI warning/instruction in xl3-web
+- **Pros**: Simple, no code changes
+- **Cons**: Poor UX, defeats purpose of remote management
+
+**Plan C: Contact Novation Support**
+- Request official protocol documentation
+- Report potential firmware issue
+- Request firmware update to accept inactive slot writes
+- **Pros**: Authoritative answer, potential permanent fix
+- **Cons**: Long timeline, uncertain outcome
+
+**Plan D: Read-Modify-Active-Slot Pattern**
+- Read from target slot ‚Üí memory
+- User selects slot on device
+- Write from memory to now-active slot
+- **Pros**: Works within constraints
+- **Cons**: Multi-step UX, error-prone
+
+**Plan E: Defer to Future Firmware**
+- Document limitation clearly
+- Mark as "known issue"
+- Wait for Novation to address in firmware update
+- **Pros**: No immediate work required
+- **Cons**: Indefinite timeline, functionality blocked
+
+---
+

+1. ‚úÖ **Core Fix**: Cross-slot writes succeed without 0x9 errors

+---
+
+## Open Questions
+
+### Questions Requiring Investigation
+
+1. **What is the exact acknowledgement format for template change (0x77)?**
+   - Answered by: Phase 3
+   - Impact: Determines if we can use acknowledgement wait vs fixed delay
+
+2. **What is the minimum safe delay between slot selection and write?**
+   - Answered by: Phase 2 timing tests
+   - Impact: Determines write operation latency
+
+3. **Does the device send any response to template change command?**
+   - Answered by: Phase 1 MIDI capture
+   - Impact: Determines acknowledgement wait feasibility
+
+4. **Are there any side effects of programmatic slot switching?**
+   - Answered by: Phase 2 real device testing
+   - Impact: Determines user experience considerations
+
+### Questions for Product/UX
+
+1. **Is visible slot switching on device acceptable to users?**
+   - Cannot be avoided with current firmware
+   - Alternative: require manual slot selection (poor UX)
+
+2. **Should we add progress indication for slot switching in xl3-web?**
+   - Write now takes 2-3 seconds instead of 1-2 seconds
+   - Users may wonder why operation is slower
+
+3. **Should we batch multiple slot writes to minimize switching?**
+   - Example: Queue all writes, group by slot, minimize switches
+   - Trade-off: Complexity vs. performance
+

+# Issue #36: Device Firmware Slot Rejection - Diagnostic Workplan
+
+**Issue**: Launch Control XL3: Device firmware rejects writes to inactive slots (status 0x9)
+**Status**: Investigation Phase
+**Created**: 2025-10-12
+**Branch**: `issues/36-slot-rejection`
+**Severity**: High - Core functionality blocked
+
+---
+
+## Problem Statement
+
+### Summary
+
+The Novation Launch Control XL3 device firmware **rejects write operations to slots that are not currently active** on the physical device, returning status code `0x9` (device rejection). This prevents programmatic multi-slot management from working, blocking core functionality in the xl3-web application.
+
+### Impact
+
+**Functionality Blocked**:
+- Users cannot copy modes between slots programmatically
+- Multi-slot management from web UI is non-functional
+- Limits device to effectively one user-programmable slot at a time
+- Defeats purpose of 15-slot architecture for remote management
+
+**Data Integrity**: Safe - Device rejects invalid operations cleanly (no corruption risk)
+
+### Environment
+
+- **Device**: Novation Launch Control XL3 (Serial: LX280935400469)
+- **Firmware**: v1.0.10.84
+- **Library**: @oletizi/launch-control-xl3 v1.20.2
+- **Web App**: xl3-web v0.1.0
+- **Related Issue**: oletizi/xl3-web#4
+
+---
+
+## Analysis & Evidence
+
+### Code Review Findings
+
+#### 1. Acknowledgement Handling (DeviceManager.ts)
+
+**Location**: `src/device/DeviceManager.ts:70, 441-451`
+
+\```typescript

+private pendingAcknowledgements = new Map<number, {
+  resolve: () => void;
+  reject: (error: Error) => void;
+  timeout: NodeJS.Timeout;
+```

+
+**Task**: Modify DeviceManager.writeCustomMode() to add slot pre-selection before writes.
+
+**Workplan Reference**: modules/audio-control/docs/1.20/issues/36/implementation/workplan.md (see Phase 4)
+
+**Specific Changes Required**:
+
+1. **File**: `package/src/device/DeviceManager.ts`
+2. **Method**: `writeCustomMode()` at line ~591
+3. **Change**: Add slot selection before write
+
+**Implementation**:
+
+```typescript
+async writeCustomMode(slot: number, mode: CustomMode): Promise<void> {
+  if (slot < 0 || slot > 15) {
+    throw new Error('Custom mode slot must be 0-15');
+  }
+
+  // NEW: Select target slot before write
+  console.log(`[DeviceManager] Selecting slot ${slot} before write`);
+  await this.selectTemplate(slot);
+
+  // NEW: Wait for device to process slot selection (100ms conservative delay)
+  await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 100));
+
+  // EXISTING: Write to now-active slot
+  const modeData = {
+    slot,
+    name: mode.name,
+    controls: mode.controls,
+    colors: mode.colors,
+  };
+
+  const validatedModeData = this.validateCustomModeData(modeData);
+  const message = SysExParser.buildCustomModeWriteRequest(slot, validatedModeData);
+  await this.sendSysEx(message);
+}
+```
+
+**Requirements**:
+- Use the EXISTING `selectTemplate(slot)` method (already implemented at line 520)
+- Add a 100ms delay for device processing (conservative, can optimize later)
+- Preserve all existing write logic
+- No breaking changes to API
+
+**Testing**:
+After implementation, create a simple test to verify the change:
+- Verify selectTemplate is called before write
